page.title: 07Swanton Morley School 1
page.content:
The present school was opened in 1917, and remained largely unchanged until the 1950's and the expansion of the R.A.F. quarters. The increased population led to the addition of extra classrooms in several stages, to accommodate the ever-increasing number of children on roll (from a small rural school to a maximum number in the mid 1970's of 465 children of primary school age).
At present, July 1985, there are 226 children on roll, taught by 9 teachers. Approximately 60% of the children are from R.A.F. families.
In addition to the normal subjects in the curriculum of a typical primary school, the children can take part in several voluntary leisure activities.
